title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of one interview in Waltham. You check in, then was introduced to team members. Finally a sit down interview with the manager. Overall, it was a very standard interview process.
Interview Questions: How you like to work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Ask my work experience and expected start date and I asked my salary range. I think the process is not complicated and not hard. There is a phone screening and second zoom interview.
Interview Questions: Whats your duty of work?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: received an email from the lab manager one day after submitting the application, scheduled a brief zoom interview, asked common questions such as "tell me about yourself", "your previous research experience" the interviewer told me that he'd give back to me about a week, but after a month, nothing happened, just ghosted
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself your previous research experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview process. Called back very quickly. They were nice people. and answered all of my questions. It was a fast and didn't have a bad experience.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this job?

title: Milieu Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a Human Resources phone screening which included review of Resume and Cover Letter, and then an interview with the Clinical or Nursing director which also included reviews of Resume and Cover Letter.
Interview Questions: How do you set boundaries with your patients?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Took less than 45 minutes. It was by the physician. I had to wait 10 minutes to get in, which was not cool. I did not get the job so can’t speak any further.
Interview Questions: What interest you the most about this job?

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: They reach out to you through email. The person would schedule you for the interview, where you will get an invitation based on your availability. My interview got postponed once during the process.
Interview Questions: They ask why you want to work for the hospital and what your availability is.

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone call and follow up interview with 3-4 members of the nursing staff. It was a behavioral style interview and last about 40 minutes. Turn around time was slower than I would have liked so didn’t end up with BCH
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: They had 3 rounds of interviews which were all pretty standard. They just asked about previous experiences regarding project management and why I applied for the role then left time for questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this role?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview process and turn around time. Initially the interview was set to be with one individual however, 3 people joined the zoom unexpectedly. But everyone was very nice and I enjoyed speaking with them.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you we’re worried about your patient.

title: Program Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: In my experience, every step of the process was very smooth and my recruiter was very communicative with updates and scheduling interview times. All of the staff I had interacted with throughout my interviews were very friendly and informative
Interview Questions: What are some things that motivate you?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Simple and quick. There was 2 to threerounds of interview. They ask you to submit an online application. The 1st round is a phone interview. If everything is ok and they like you there is a 2nd round interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Series of interviews . Initial phone screen. I thought overall was a long and time consuming process. Boston Children’s attracts a lot of talent so they have a thorough hiring and review system.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Why do you think you are a good candidate?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: recruiter reached out to set up interview. position sounded like more of an executive position being marketed as a program coordinator. they advertised as "hybrid" but only allow 1 WFH day.
Interview Questions: typical questions regarding past experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The process is very long and it took a lot of time to get an interview they focused more on resume and experience. The interview wasn't hard but the wait time is alot
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Microsoft teams, met with 2 others on the real estate and planning team who asked about my experience and past situational experiences and how they were handled. Spoke about the hybrid work experience and the challenges and benefits.
Interview Questions: Experience, availability, flexibility, behavioral interviewing

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: HR screening then interview with department. The interview process was phone and then zoom video conference. It was pretty fast since they were hiring urgently, I was invited for another interview but declined due to the budget they had for the role being far below what I was looking for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? Explain a bit about yourself and what led to applying for this role?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager, then met with HR. They reached out to me after applying to a different position. Met with the entire team over the course of several interviews. Was told I'd hear back next steps within a few days, several weeks later still had not heard a single update.
Interview Questions: What excites you about this role

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: took a long time to hear back - interview process was quite drawn out and it seems like HR lost my application at one point. Once given offer it was a very smooth process.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work at BCH

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly straight forward interview . Spoke with three different managers, all were pleasant. Lots of situational scenarios and personality based questions. Took about an hour to go through all the questions
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult coworker?

title: UX Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I had three Zoom interviews over course of several weeks with two designers among other employees for a remote position that is more so focused on evaluative research (usability testing).
Interview Questions: Can you give an example of how you used data to make design recommendations?

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Organized process between HR and hiring manager and team. Great experience. Questions were straight forward and expected. Why you want the role, previous experience, interests, etc. Whole process probably took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Previous experience and why you’re interested in the role

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: They seem to have a candidate already in mind. Not sure why were they interviewing me. Everyone came 10 minutes after my given time to start because their previous meeting ended late.
Interview Questions: Details of my research work

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Structured interview process over a two day period involving a tour around the department, one on one meetings with relevant staff, and giving a seminar to researchers and clinician personnel.
Interview Questions: What are your long term plans for developing a research program?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: They would reach out through email 1st for phone screening. If you go through that then they would arrange another interview. It's a little lengthy process but worth the time. You would get to learn through the process itself.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in next 5 years?

title: Infection Preventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Mountain View, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with someone and was told I'll be given a decision in the next 2 weeks as I told her there's another offer I'm waiting to respond on. She didn't and kept giving me the run-around as she wanted to shop for other candidates. In the end, she never even got back with a decision...disgusting lady.
Interview Questions: What infection prevention work have you done? What are your hobbies?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on their career portal . HR phone screening 15-20 minutes then zoom interview with hiring manager 30 min- 1 hour . The timeline was about 3 to 4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself and why you’re interested in this role.

title: Emergency Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone screening
2. Interview with entire team
3. Interview with entire team again (they'll ask for a writing sample)
4. Ask for references if you pass second interview. 
5. Based on references, you will be selected from there.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about the process you went through before making a hard decision 

Tell me about a time you had to effectively communicate with others and how did you get them on board. 

What do you do to manage stress?

What are you looking for in a supervisor?

What's you're preferred working environment?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: An agency referred me. I did the standard phone screen with them. Then came the interview with the hiring manager. It took nearly 3 weeks of asking about my availability to schedule a time to meet with her. The interview seemed very rushed and I could tell she wasn't interested. I wasn't given the opportunity to ask any questions
Interview Questions: How do you find candidates in such a tough market?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't an HR phone screen before the interview. There was only one interview in person. Interviewed with boss and met team. Got a tour of the space. Overall positive experience.
Interview Questions: What are your plans for further education

title: Pulmonary Function Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview is very informative and they touch upon certain responsibilities that will distinguish whether you may be a great candidate for them. Overall, if you have experience performing these tests then you will be fine.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with their hospital based system? (Epic)

title: Surgical Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted a few rounds, I would say 3. Met with multiple people for the last round. Was helpful to put a face to a name and meet with multiple people from the department
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Set up a phone interview with HR, after a few weeks, had interviews with my future manager. They proceeded with my hiring after submitting several references through a portal, who would submit a review for you.
Interview Questions: Q: What made me excited about applying?

title: Human Resources Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from a recruiter. Then was scheduled for a  virtual interview with two people from the department. Was told at the end of interview, I just had the department manager to interview with but the initial recruiter would reach out to me and set it up. Never happened. Never heard anything. My application was still in the “interviewing” stage over the next week or so. Then around 10 days later my application was changed to “rejected”. And that’s it. Thankfully I was hired by someone who valued my time.
Interview Questions: How do you keep on track with many tasks?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with HR. Then 6 days later, I had an interview on zoom with the technical supervisors. The interview was very casual and more like a conversation than anything. Later that day was asked to submit references. One week later I was offered the job
Interview Questions: How do you handle change?

title: Quality Improvement Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Starts with a basic phone screen. The next step is a meeting with the director of the department. Then I met with two members of the team. Then they ghost you and you never hear anything back. Extremely unprofessional after having 3 rounds of interviews.
Interview Questions:
What about this position interest you?
Why do you want to work here?
Talk a lot about previous experience.

title: Emergency Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, then two Zoom interviews with the entire team.  Will ask for writing sample by third interview. Then a check on your references before hiring. Took about a month and a half.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you need to gain buy-in from your stakeholders

title: Administrative Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Simple, laid-back and informative. Interviewers were eventually my supervisors, and it was a great introduction to the program. Easy interview and great experience. Discussed certain tech skills and why I wanted to work at Boston Children's Hospital.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at BCH?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I met with research assistants for the lab, and they asked me questions about customer and teamwork experience. They also told me more about the role, and answered my questions. They also asked me about any situation that I had been in when working in teams where any member was difficult.
Interview Questions: Do you have any teamwork/customer experience?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Good Process and very easy to get in touch with HR. I spoke to hr and then to the team who I am  working with.; zoom interview during the pandemic was nice as well
Interview Questions: What did you do in former Job?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Met with human resources, they did not seem pleased to see me.  I'm honestly not sure why they interviewed me since they were so grumpy. Did not ask a lot of questions just wanted to hear my experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and walk us through your resume?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interviews with directors of the center. A lot of behavioral questions in the first few rounds. Asked about past research experiences and why you want to work here. Also introduced the position.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply here?

title: Sr. QA Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. They know what they want, however when it comes to work there are lots of gray area and new one will be in Lime light and exploring new tech is almost impossible.
Interview Questions: Mostly on what I worked and what they want. They are tool specific company and almost most of system is legacy. Have to work hard when you look for your future company.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was a Three step process. Screen, first interview and then a second interview. Went very well! Great experience and great company to work for. People were nice enough and seemed to be a lot of internal growth at the time.
Interview Questions: What wanted to be in 5 years

title: Program Coordinator II Interview

Interview Descriptions: inpersonal and not welcoming, brief, did not go in depth regarding my experience or the position at all. Genetic rare diseases barely discussed. Not sure the goal they had in mind. Wish I did not interview as they were not necessarily friendly
Interview Questions: when can you start? what are your goals?

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: thorough, informative and conclusive. Enjoyed the interview and the hiring process. thorough, informative and conclusive. Enjoyed the interview and the hiring process. thorough, informative and conclusive. Enjoyed the interview and the hiring process.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: quick questions about how to deal with bad people and why you want to work here and any other past work experience that is similar to this job that would help you with this ob
Interview Questions: how would you deal with a bad patient

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: 4 interviews, first two short and the other went deeper into personal and professional experience. They asked experience about research and autism particularly, as well as personal and communicational skills
Interview Questions: Experience on research and autism

title: Sr Business Analyst IT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was with a HR. She joined in late. She wrapped interview in 10 min. Interview was about current  experience and details of current job. I thought it went well but never heard back from her.
Interview Questions: Why you stayed with your company so long?

title: Clinical Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: After 2 interviews, they asked for references, then went on to another 4 interviews. A lot of time consuming and no offer made. everything was roughly around 1 month.  HR told me this  position is not a good fit for me said they typically pay 40-42k for position like this... over all, not really a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself typical question

title: Insurance Biller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It was not intense it was just like applying for any job I felt at ease answering the questions pertaining to my work experience and I also asked questions pertaining to growth within the company
Interview Questions: What are your greatest assets

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Multi tiered process, took a longer time than expected due to BCH Human Resources negotiating with the specific division I’m in. Asked classic interview questions at all stages, were responsive to my questions.
Interview Questions: How do you manage stress and competing priorities?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I have only met with an hr woman so far for 15 minutes. It was a solid conversation and she asked questions that were straight to the point. Good experience.
Interview Questions: How would this position support your career goals?

title: Clinical Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, first had a screening meeting with a team acquisition recruiter over Zoom. Then was interviewed by the team of three different people including another clinical assistant and the senior manager. They seemed to have very few questions for me and expected me to have a more questions. There was a lack of diversity in the interviewers in my opinion. The only thing that different between them demographically was age: same gender, race, among other things.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and what can you bring to the team?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Participated in three rounds of interviews: a phone screen, manager interview, and peer interview. These virtual interviews were between 30 minutes and 1 hour each. Each round of interviews lead to the next and provided a holistic view of the role.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with clinicians?

title: Director of Corporate Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I had several remote interviews via Zoom, which were each scheduled for less than an hour. In total, I met with at least six people remotely. This process was as smooth as it could be. Following that process I met with two people in-person (COVID rates were low at that point and I felt perfectly safe).  I was one of two final candidates for the position and enjoyed the process. However, following such a significant investment of my time no one from their staff reached out to notify me that I was not selected. 

A few months later I began receiving fundraising appeals from Boston Children's, despite never having donated to them in the past. I don't think that this is malicious, per se, but I don't think that it's appropriate for job seekers information to be added to fundraising databases. I work at a different health care organization now, and there is absolutely no way that we would do that.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about how you met your fundraising goals? 
How do you collaborate with others?

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview with the HR who asks basic questions about yourself and what kind of work you're looking for. Then they forward this to the team for a 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 2-5 years?

title: Research Assitant Interview

Interview Descriptions: All online - zoom interview with PI, and 2 postdocs, and then came into the lab in person to talk with other lab members. Initial interview took about an hour, talked about past experiences and projects I will be working on.
Interview Questions: Past research experiences. Mainly talked about their research area. Good to go over some of their recent papers

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and then later in the same day I heard back and was invited for a phone interview.  I spoke directly with the Principal Investigator over the phone for about 15 minutes.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Troy, NY) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Talent coordinator emailed within a day of applying, set a date to talk. Interview was on phone for about 15 minutes talking about experience and basic skills. Was very kind and sent info to lab managers.
Interview Questions: Explain what you did in a prior lab experience.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: First call was a 10 minute phone screen then moved forward with 4 in person interviews. Each person asked different questions mixed in with standard why are you interested questions.
Interview Questions: Why BCH and why now?

title: Associate Patient Experience Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very Good. Recruiters is kind. Initial Phone screen then interview in person with future boss.  Got the job offer a week later. Accepter then trained for a week or 2

title: Radiology Aide Interview

Interview Descriptions: Overall great and the manager was super informative. He didn’t really ask me many questions but he let me know how a normal day to day is. Also I went ahead and asked him some questions as well. So over al it’s went great
Interview Questions: What made you apply to this position ?

title: Industrial Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone call, I spoke with the manger and we had 30 m interview, he told me that he will inform me about the next steps if they decide to move with my application

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2021

Interview Questions:
What is your experience?
Why do you want to work for BCH?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2021

title: Research Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume through their online portal and was contact by a recruiter for a standard phone screen. They scheduled 3 1 hour interviews with the hiring manager, technical lead, and senior software developer. Those interviews went very well, my background was a great fit for the position. Next came a take home coding exercise, building a sample JavaScript application. I completed the exercise, and was scheduled another 1 hour code review session with the technical lead. The feedback I received was that it was a great submission. After 12 hours of take home exercises and interviews, the team was excited to invite me to Boston for an onsite interview. I'm usually hesitant and skeptical of onsite technical interviews for positions in another location, because the companies usually don't respect my time and may ask questions during the interview that could just as easily be asked remotely. They kept contacting me about the onsite interview, and the recruiter told me they plan on offering me a position. I asked if there would be any whiteboard coding exercises during the interview. I usually don't agree to onsite interviews with whiteboard coding for several reasons, but one is that I would be traveling and probably wouldn't get a good night sleep the night before the interview.  The recruiter reached out to the team and responded that there wouldn't. I agreed to travel to Boston for the onsite interview. I arrived in Boston at the hotel the night before the interview. Guess what, the hotel was right next to the hospital, and there were traffic and beeping noises all throughout the night. I couldn't sleep well. I believe I drifted half asleep for about 1 hour. The interview was scheduled for 8:30am EST, which is usually very early for me because I live in CST. I arrived at 8:30 to meet the team. I was taken to a small room with a conference table and whiteboard. The room was very hot and humid and I started sweating profusely as they discussed the process. They insisted that I stand up and draw on the whiteboard as I described the architecture for a system without any preparation time. They asked me to draw mock-ups as well, with very vague direction on what they wanted out of the system. They were making this up as they went, describing functionality to make it more complicated as I tried to ad-hoc the system design on less than 1 hour of sleep on a Monday morning.  My brain wasn't functioning 100% due to lack of sleep. They asked me to write a SQL query on the whiteboard. I started going along with it. I started laughing and turned around and pointed out that they said there wouldn't be any whiteboard coding exercises. I struggled through more of writing the query while bent over sweating profusely in the humid conference room. They eventually asked me to go back to drawing more mock-ups, I was basically coming up with requirements and functionality off the top of my head because their requirements were so vague. Eventually they had enough and directed me to go have coffee with the team. I grabbed my backpack and we walked to the coffee shop. I chatted with the senior engineers. The hiring manager eventually joined us. I went to the airport directly afterwards. I didn't hear a peep from this company after the interview. Actually, I did hear back from them, only when I had to send about 15 emails and wait 2 months to be reimbursed for my travel expenses. What a waste of time.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal next position.

title: Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a negative experience interviewing with Boston Children's for a role in their finance department. It was unfortunate because I had a positive experience with the managers I interviewed with. My experience with the HR contact, however, was extremely unprofessional. I applied online and received an email from an HR professional asking if I could come in for an interview. I had a first round interview with the manager, which went positively. About a week later the HR contact emailed me asking if a few days the following week would work to come in and meet with other members of the team and a senior manager. I responded within an hour saying yes to one of the times. Then I never heard back. I emailed her again a few days later checking in, and didn't hear back. The next week, the day before the time I had confirmed, I figured she probably wanted to cancel, but just to be sure, I emailed one last time to make sure I would not be coming in the next morning for a second round. She emailed back at 6:30 saying she had had a busy day but that we were all set for 9 the next morning. I was shocked but did not want to postpone since I would be interviewing with multiple people. So I went in the next morning for 9, feeling not as prepared as I would have liked. My contact was late, and said that unfortunately since "we had scheduled this interview so last minute," only the senior manager was able to meet with me, not the rest of the team. I was surprised, since I thought the only communication mix-up was this woman not getting back to me. My interview with the senior manager was alright, but as I said I was a little frazzled at this point. Afterward the HR woman sat with me again and talked for awhile about company culture and a lot of random things, and said she would be in touch to set up a third interview with the team. I said that would be fine, and reached out a week later to check in. She emailed back saying they were still making decisions, and then I never heard from her again. Honestly, it was an unfortunate experience and it was unclear to me if they were never serious about interviewing, or what. But, as I said, the employees I interviewed with were great, but the process was pretty terrible.
Interview Questions: Describe why you are looking for a new position.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I first got in touch with the nurse recruiter and set up a time and date. I met with nurse recruiter first to talk about my interests in nursing. She had set my interview the nurse manager for the unit I applied for. Afterwards I met with the nurse manager where I interviewed, got a tour and met some of the other staff nurses on the unit.
Interview Questions: What are three characteristics that describe you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief phone interview, then I was invited to come in for an interview with two members of the team and then was asked for a second in-person interview with the project's two primary investigators.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a problem?

title: OR/CPD Materials Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied in late December via external application, received interview offer from HR 3 weeks after submitting application. Interviewed 1:1 with a senior member in the dept. at the hospital and again with HR in the landmark center the same day.
Interview Questions: How often do I reorganize my work space

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and thorough, to the point questions and professional. Great experience and met great staff. Would recommend to everyone.!!!!!!! Went through multiple phone calls and processes, along with background checks and FBI fingerprinting.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: 5 rounds of interview that started with meeting the VP followed by meeting 7 directors and then going back for a face to face presentation in front of all leadership and then meeting with all chief officers like the CFO, CNO, CIO, CTO and CAO.  The whole process was over 16 months with long delays between all these steps and no clear communication as to why there was a delay or hold up.  The process was long and even after completing all the steps and being told I was the finalist and that my ofc was already setup I was told the job is on hold in Dec 2017.  I believe the HR is not organized and communication is very poor
Interview Questions: Questions ranged from project management to leadership to change management to staff management including consultants.  All of these experiences was something I had earned over many years.  Their job description was very vague and required only program/ project management, experience with vendors and consultants and change management.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the manager of the lab, then brought in for an in-person interview! The in-person interview lasted approximately 2 hours. I met with all of the research assistants in the lab and then the physician. I was given a tour of the lab itself and also some of the Boston Children's facility!
Interview Questions: Past experiences that would relate to my position as a Research Assistant.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: nine thirty  minute interviews  with both PAs and physicians. Overall was a great experience with wonderful providers. Answered all questions and asked standard interview questions with minimal curveballs
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging experience with an attending and how you handled that situation

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position as an employee referral and got contacted by a recruiter via email within a couple days asking if I would be available within a couple days for an interview. I had wanted to work at BCH for awhile because I was a patient there for 14 years and wanted to give back in a way.  I was scheduled to interview with the recruiter and then 3 different employees in the department that I would have worked in. The interview with the recruiter was pleasant. However, when I went to the other building to interview with the other people, I found out that 2/3 of them were not there today and so I only interviewed with one of them. That 1 interview seemed to go well, although I was not asked many questions about my experience. I was told that the recruiter would contact me early next week. So I sent out my thank you emails and waited. After 9 business days of not hearing anything, I sent a follow-up email to let the recruiter know I was still interested. He said that because it was around Thanksgiving, other interviews were more challenging to schedule and that he would get back to me soon. It has been a month since my interview and I've never heard back. I'm frustrated that I had a clear disadvantage by not getting to interview with the two women that I was supposed to when other candidates did. I'm frustrated that they did not bother to tell me that I didn't get the job (I'm assuming I did not and I got a different job in the time since). I suppose they only care about communication when they're collecting your insurance money.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Comparable to other interviews.  There was an obvious elitist attitude among some of the interviewing staff members however some of the younger staff are much more empathetic and more reasonable and overall discussions went better.
Interview Questions: Why I wasn’t published yet

Was then contacted by another recruiter that had set up an interview with HR and 4 supervisors as a group. Then a week later I was asked to come in for a 2nd interview which was very comfortable. Weeks went by and I contacted the HR department to make sure I was still being considered, which I was; then 3 weeks went by and I didn't hear anything. I then emailed HR to verify my status and she stated she will let me know at the end of the week. One week went by and I had to email HR again to see if they had made a decision. The next morning I got an email stating they picked someone else.

Worst interview I've had in 5 years.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016

They then asked me for more detail on my experience related to the position. This information was passed along to the research head, who then decided whether or not to pursue a formal interview. I was contacted a week later to setup a skype interview date as I am located outside of MA and looking to relocate. Another week later I received an email from HR asking for references to contact. After another week the reference was contacted.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a call about the role, the Children's recruiter left a vm to get in touch with her about the role.  However, the phone # given was either fictitious or she didn't pick up calls on that line.  After numerous attempts at reaching the recruiter thru that # failed I finally reached her on LinkedIn email.  Her response was "I'm in meetings, will call you today".  The call never came, nor any other email or communication about the role.  A simple "no" would have been easier, but I guess that's why people hate recruiters of all shapes and sizes.
Interview Questions: What's the color of the sky?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online and in a few days was asked to come into Boston Children's Hospital for an interview with the project manager and one of the physicians. The interview was very relaxed and felt like the interviewers were simply trying to get to know me through a conversation. It seemed to have gone really well and they said they would let me know their decision in about a week. However, despite sending them a follow up email and leaving a voicemail inquiring about the status of my application, I was never given the courtesy of any sort of response or notification.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied in June and got asked for a phone interview several weeks later. The recruiter was lovely and I was invited for an in-person interview that was scheduled the next week. I met with four women on the team for 45 minutes each. Everyone was great - conversation flowed and no one grilled me with questions. The last woman I met with told me not to get freaked out if I don't hear anything for a few days because their HR department is slow - and I was warned by friends that hospital HR departments are awful. I followed up w/ HR a week later because I was offered a position elsewhere, but really wanted the job at Children's. I was told they were still going through the application process and wouldn't be making a decision with the next few days. I was bummed, but understood and even declined my competing offer in the hopes of getting this job. It's been two months and I sent another follow-up, which was ignored. The actual interviews were enjoyable, but the lack communication left a sour taste in my mouth - don't waste your time.
Interview Questions: Why Children's?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter to schedule an interview after applying online. I interviewed with 3 individuals separately (Recruiter, Program Manager, Program Director). HR let you know in advance exactly who you were talking to and their positions in advance and each interview was about 20-30 minutes. The only negative was that no one ever let me know my application status after the interview. I had to call and ask to find out I was not offered the job.

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

She also asked me the PI name which I think she was doing to make sure I did my research on the position. She also asked me if I had any problems doing mice work? She asked me to make a list of all the science techniques I knew.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
Addendum: The PI did get back to me with interest, despite the posting apparently going offline. Though I am now working for a different employer, and so withdrew my application while thanking them for their interest and time.

Applied a couple weeks before the holiday break, and HR called me shortly before New Year's to ask if I was still interested, and as I still was, said that the PI was interested in inviting me onsite having seen my resume, and would plan on scheduling a visit after the PI came back from vacation. Oddly enough, never heard back again, and now the job posting is gone too. While I have since received and accepted another offer, I find it odd that any interviewer would show interest in scheduling a meeting with a candidate, and then leave them in the dust without so much as a preliminary screening.
Interview Questions: Only "interview" I even had was HR planning to schedule me to come onsite after the PI came back, before complete radio silence

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Professional yet very friendly and stress free. They definitely want to see that you're serious about the job and have previous research experience. Most PI's ask for two year commitments which is reasonable since there is a bit of a learning curve. They're very interested in where you go to school and getting to know you as a person. Phone interview, and if they are interested in pursuing you, they will give you an onsite interview where you will meet members of the lab. If the members of the lab think you're a good fit, the job is yours.
Interview Questions: What previous research have you done and what research skills do you have?

title: Ambulatory Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Children's Hospital?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2016

Each interviewer was kind, friendly, and very professional in their line of questioning and were very informative.  I learned a lot about the project, departmental needs and objectives, and the workplace culture.
Interview Questions: What project management skills do you have?  Give an example of a time you had to manage a difficult situation and how you dealt with it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Started with phone screening. Then I came in for full-day interview. Interviewed with each individual lab member and principle investigator. Took about 4-5 hours to complete. Also attended one of their Monday lab meetings.

title: Applications Development Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Overall process:
1. Call - HR:
Asked some basic background questions to assess if I am the right candidate for the role
2. Call - Manager:
Initial screening focused to check, if I qualify technically for the role.
3. In person - Scripting & OOPS_Technical Interview: 3 rounds of about an hour each

The in-person interview was for about 3 hours during which, got a chance to meet development team and several case-studies were discussed to see my analytical thinking. They were mostly interested in checking my approach to solve various technical scenarios that involved some white-board usage., this went on for about 90 mins. Following which I had another 90-minute session during which, the same interview team reviewed my code to solve the same technical questions related to the scenarios discussed in the first round. Most of the questions were pretty straight forward and simple. A couple of them were from the most common interview questions list.

4. 2nd In person - Data Engineering_Technical Interview: This was much shorter than the previous technical interview. Given that I was called for this interview 3 months after my first one, this was pretty short one. I was handed code in paper and asked to review it for bugs and complexity. Duration was for about 60 minutes.
Interview Questions: Basic questions related to SQL, Database design & architecture, PHP & Object-oriented programming

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from HR to schedule an interview a couple weeks after submitting an application. I first interviewed with a recruiter from HR to discuss availability and salary expectations. Then I spoke to the hiring manager immediately after. The interview was easy and felt comfortable. We discussed the details of the position (the job posting was vague and generic). The interviewer asked questions about my past experience, education, and skills.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my data management and analysis skills

title: Research Trainee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: No Interview was done. The whole process was for a summer internship program called Harvard Summer Kidney Program. Application process involved answering questions on why this program was important and how it would contribute to my career. Applications were due at the end of January and we heard in March.
Interview Questions: Only application on why I wanted the internship.

title: Patient Services Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy, easy to get in and the process was rather quick. A representative from HR called and gave an interview time for the following week. Though it was hard to navigate to the office of the person of which I was interviewing with, the process was rather simple.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Since I was referred, there was no phone screening. 1st round was an on-site interview with the project manager. Basically, we went over my working experience. 2nd round was with two directors/PIs. Most of the discussion were very technical.
Interview Questions:
How to do data check?
Data manipulation skills.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted to set up initial interview with lab manager for a new lab that was being constructed. Met with him as he was doing prescreens for interviews with the MD lab director in the next few weeks. Interview lasted about 20 minutes in the cafeteria. Im very professional, and clean cut, as I have been doing customer facing training in labs including FDA headquarters for 15 years, so I always dress professionally.  Lab manager I met with was a freak show - dressed in old T-shirt and shorts, with grommet earrings, tats on face and neck, so I knew instantly when I saw him I had no chance. Afterwards I never heard back, even though I specifically requested to let me know yes or no if they were interested in pursuing me further.
Interview Questions: Lab tech experience, specifically wet chemistry

title: Clinical Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I have heard the process is slow if HR is in charged. I was lucky to have a proactive manager; she reviewed all the applications and told HR to contact me. I received a call in 4 days, met with the recruiter (very nice and professional) and the next two days I interviewed with the CDI staff.
Interview Questions: It was more HIM (coding/DRG) questions....more focus to the job description. Very professional and smart women who knew what they were looking for.

title: Staff Nurse I Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process went smoothly. Was nervous at first than realized I just needed to be myself. The HR recruiter and the Nurse Manager were welcoming. The interview was formal but still conversational.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Leadership in some areas of the company had struggled to remain cohesive during a period of internal consolidation of branches of the organization. Excellent people departed the company, and that left huge holes and gaps. The people left behind have stepped up and steered the ship in an extremely positive manner. So, this isnt really a "con", but an example of how the company can navigate through tricky waters and come out shining.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application online that included basic questions about why I wanted to volunteer and what skills I have that would make me right for the position. I was emailed to schedule an in-person interview. The interview was originally supposed to be a group interview but ended up being 1 on 1. The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous experience, how I handled some situations in past experience, how my past experience should help me in the future, why I wanted to volunteer, details of my schedule... very basic interview questions.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called and asked me if I was still interested. Once I told them I was, was invited for an in person interview. Was asked to describe research experience, the usual dance.
Interview Questions: Describe your research

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: It took four interviews to get an entry level position due to logistics, through initially meeting with HR to meeting at university to interviewing with the department two times. The process was long, drawn out and unnecessary. They glide by based off the hospital's reputation and more needs to be done for employee satisfaction.
Interview Questions: What my biggest strengths were, what past employers would say about my job performance

title: Ambulatory Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview and was schedule to have it a week and a half later. I interviewed with three individuals. Two mangers and one hiring mangers. Interview Questions: How would you deal with a overwhelming situation?

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took about a month. I first had a phone screening with two members of the team, and was invited back for a in person interview. The interview was with the director and about three team members
Interview Questions: How do you feel about telling people no when it comes to tight expectations regarding reports

title: Research COordinator of Center for Adolescent Substance Abuse Research Interview

I was not aware that their was an advertized position.  However after taking the job I realized that what they had told me I would be doing during our interview did not match what I ended up doing which was far more on the administration side (budgets and contracts and office management) than on the research side which is where my experience lies and was reflected in my resume and interview
Interview Questions: They asked me if I was single and if I had kids.

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy...basic first you meet with the human resource recruiter and then he sends you off to the Departments that are interested in you. You could do two interviews in one day and not even know it

title: Research Assistant II Interview

Overall, I enjoyed meeting with everyone as they were interested in learning about my future goals and interests.

title: ASR Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Very general, basic questions and procedures. Met a representative who was really great and I bonded with, definitely proved they have a lot of great people there. I would definitely interview again
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Administrative Associate II Interview

Interview Descriptions: Watch out HR does a bate-in-switch.  You apply for one job, and they call you to tell you that job is filled (still on company website) but would you like to interview for other positions.  This happened to me and a couple of coworkers.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Had two to three interviews with different members of the team
It seemed excessive for the skills required for the position
all behavioral Qs
they seemed committed to finding a good fit for the office, though
they know you're going to leave and go to grad school but they're looking for a two-year commitment from people

title: Billing Coordinator Interview

two phone call interviews. Both were relatively short compared to my other interviews. Very general. they asked me questions like:why you chose non-profit vs profit companies. 
second round is on-site interview. i met my supervisor and a senior staff in the morning. interview was about 30 mins each.  They scheduled another interview with my supervisor's boss and the department director. less than 30 mins. the second was very straightforward. title: Administrative Associate III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2015

title: Surgical Scheduler Interview

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2015

title: Grant Administrator Interview

title: Research Associate Interview

Extremely low starting salary. Multiple unanswered callbacks over the span of several weeks led me to give up. After 2.5-3 months I got an email saying they had hired someone else. I had received a better job offer by then, but the poor communication left a bitter taste in my mouth.

title: Radiology Imaging Assistant Interview

title: Security Officer Interview

I had to apply online numerous times as I never got a call back, the administration is sloppy and take a very long time to provide you information regarding time off.
Interview Questions: What was the worst decision you had made in your life and why?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was contacted fairly quickly after submitting my resume and cover letter online. I went through an initial phone screen. I was then invited for an in person interview and called a little over a week later for a reference check. I am still waiting to hear back.

title: Research Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:

I had a chance to meet director of core.

I accepted
Interview Questions:
not much 
All the questions are reasonable and I could answer for that.

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Ambulatory Service Representative II Interview

Many of them had different personalities, so I knew it wasn't going to be a difficult environment to thrive in.
Interview Questions: Based on your past experience, please provide a time where you feel you didn't provide your best service to a customer. What what the situation and looking back now, how would you correct it?

title: Administrative Associate III Interview

Interview Descriptions: Long process. Recruiters are super busy so may not get back to you quickly but if the managers are interested they will surely get back to you. There are several types of interviews, one on one, group and if you get a 2nd interview, you are one of the lucky few.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, why you want this position...etc.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by my direct supervisor for the position. We had a conversation about my past experiences in healthcare and what I knew about the position.  They enjoyed hearing about my knowledge on the department and my goals in the field.

title: Marketing Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied online through InternMatch, received an email next day through the system to setup an initial phone interview lasted about 15 minutes talking about previous experience at college. After a couple days got another email which led to another group conference phone interview. Two different women than the initial interviewer were on the other end talking about the position and what they were looking for in an intern and what they hoped to accomplish at the end of the internship. A week later after this I was emailed an offer for the position.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions everything was straight forward pertaining to the position, the only lengthy question to answer was probably how I can apply my previous experience to this position and why I should be chosen.

title: Senior Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: at first its very intimadating. But The interview was very Short and to the point.human resourses was very helpful and pleasant. it was more of a conversation than an interrogation. I can't say enough about this place. Wonderful place to work.
Interview Questions: Can you handle stressful situations

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, then invited for a face-to-face interview with the Research Coordinator, Project Manager, PI, and current RA. Was given a tour of the lab and met with additional staff.
Interview Questions:
What has been your favorite research project and why? Your least favorite?
Tell me about a boss you had that you admired? Tell me about a boss you had that you disliked, and why?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from the coordinator to schedule an in-person interview after about a week (no phone screen). I think my application was helped by a second-degree internal connection. I arrived at the interview a little early, but it ended up starting a few minutes late. That didn't bother me too much only because I intentionally scheduled it for the end of my work day, but otherwise it might have.The interviewer would have potentially been my new manager, and he didn't ask me many questions. He just had a couple of questions and then spent a lot of time describing specific examples of calls I might handle in the role. That information I didn't find as useful as asking him more about what the role involved as a whole, which was much more limited in the end that what I initially expected and hoped for. It wasn't the right fit for me,so I ended up declining the invitation to a second interview, but everyone seemed really nice, especially the lovely young woman at reception.
Interview Questions: What will your job title be in 5 years?

title: Quality Improvement Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and to the point. Those who interviewed (and I say this with all respect) were great and approachable. The questions that were asked were fair and were all relevant to the position and to me (i.e. no ridiculous hypothetical questions that catch people off guard). The on boarding process unfortunately took a while (2 months) but it was worth the wait as it made sense for the hospital to be thorough of who they are hiring.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this position?

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: first I meet with the manager, then I met with a few of senior employees that I would have worked beside. then a human resource rep called and offered me the position and pay.

title: Software Development Lead Interview

Interview Descriptions: Two 2-hour phone screens and two 4-hour in person interviews. It was over the course of almost a month. Most of the people in the process seemed to feel like they could have been left out and it would not have made a difference. I interviewed with almost the entire department.
Interview Questions: Do you listen well, and how do you make sure that you're doing that?

title: Staff Nurse I Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview as a new grad nurse on a floor where I completed a semester on. Interview with HR was standard with typical questions. I find it completely unprofessional to be reading emails while in the middle of an interview. Perhaps a reschedule would have worked best. Needless to say, would not want to work at a place in which the manager can't focus on the task at hand
Interview Questions: three words to describe yourself

title: Ambulatory Service Representative II Interview

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview

Interview Descriptions: Initial HR phone interview followed by in-person HR interview and then two in-person interviews with would-be direct supervisor. title: Instructor Medicine Interview

Interview Descriptions:
long interview process. difficult relocation, very expensive real estate
no where comparable to interview at
interviews difficult to schedule
confusing process and frequent misunderstandings
many folks willing to lend a hand and show you around Boston

title: Patient Experience Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions:
very casual and basic. They just wanted to assure the language needs and curation ability.
They also ask about relevant course work and previous experience if there is any. They also perform life navigation of the system during the interview to also demonstrate the work you would be doing.

title: QI Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Largely a behavioral Interview. Aimed to assess if I would be a good fit for the team. Questions were asked to see if I had a passion for quality improvement and if the experience that I had would be relevant to QI. 

Example Questions

How will you navigate conflict within a team?
What motivates you?
Interview Questions: Give me an example of when you made a mistake at work, how did you go about handling it?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in May 2014

I heard of the job through a friend of a friend and was provided the official job description and email address of  a fellow clinical research coordinator. I sent in my cover letter and resume and heard back the same day to schedule an interview. 

The interview was incredibly friendly and welcoming, much different than interviews I have had at other hospitals. Wanted to know about my research experience, honors thesis, and generally why I was interested in the position, but didn't ask me too many situational questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with children? Why do you like them?

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview

title: Administrative Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2014
