Interview Questions: What are the molecular biology skills that you have learnt so far?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview asking about experience
Interview Questions: What did you do?

title: Clinical Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions:
I filled out the online application (including submitting a resume) and received a phone call from HR within 2-3 weeks. The HR personnel asked if I had time for a short phone interview. I replied yes, and was asked some basic questions of my experience in healthcare. Afterwards, I scheduled an interview at the hospital itself.
 
The face-to-face interviews began with nursing recruitment HR staff (same individual that I conversed with over the phone). After a short interview with them, I was led to the unit that I was interviewing for (later on I was told that this portion helped HR to determine the units that I would best fit). The Nurse Manager of the unit interviewed me, and at the end of the interview I was instructed to call the HR personnel that I initially talked to. She asked my opinion of the unit, and if I wanted to proceed. I said yes, and the HR personnel told me that she would continue with the process from her end (she said that this meant discussing it with the Nurse Manager and checking my background/references), and that I will hear from her in a couple of days. She called back in a week and told me that I received an offer.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about your best traits, and your worst traits. Why do you think that they're your best and worst?"

title: Ambulatory Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, very quick and straight and to the point.  Very friendly management. Got to see some of the kids that you'd be working with in the lobby of the wait room, which was nice to see.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Marketing Temp Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I reached out to a second degree connection on LinkedIn. Total time from initial communication to verbal offer was one week. Interviews were great - more of a conversation than back and forth question and answer. Interviewers made me feel very comfortable. I met with a total of three people.
Interview Questions: Nothing was difficult or unexpected.

title: Administrative Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter I met with was very helpful and once he had met me and gone over my resumé he set me up on some interviews within different departments. Overall each department's interview is different, but I had positive experiences all around.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the PI who was offering the position to ask for more information.  After some back and forth including a copy of my CV I was given the chance to present a seminar for the research group.  The PI paid for the flights (from Europe) and the accommodation.  I presented my work and then had one-on-one interviews with each member of the lab.  The whole affair lasted about 6 hours.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest thing you have ever done scientifically?

title: MPH Career Fair Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Multiple two minute interviews left little time for a reliable interview process with any single person.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experiences in quality management as they would relate to xyz scenarios, though the position advertised was entry level.

title: Senior Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed first with the Division Manager and an Executive Assistant to the department chief.  On the 2nd round, I met my boss and our technical director. Each separate interview was maybe about 15 minutes long.  They were relatively low-pressure interviews and the people interviewing me really wanted to get to know me personally.
Interview Questions: Are you able to complete a variety of tasks because this position requires much versatility?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 Interview with site supervisor.  Basic interview questions.  Tour of facility.  Lasted around 30 minutes.  Step-by-step process of what a typical day looks like.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from recruiter 1 month after submission of application into online portal. Interviewed with PI and other lab members. Took about 1.5 hours total.
Interview Questions: Describe a decision that you made that was a failure. How did you deal with it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online, was contacted by HR to schedule interview. Interviewed with PI via phone and was asked to come in for f2f interview that same week. Was offered the job the same week
Interview Questions: General questions about scientific background

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is exhausting because you are scheduled to meet with 3 to 4 people, 30 minutes each with out a break in between.  Although you are informed of their role at the given department, you are not made aware of the role they will have in the project as hand.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you think you should be offered the job?  What do you have to offer that is different from the 'other' candidate? What are your goals during and after this project is completed?

title: Administrative Associate III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted by HR within 2 weeks. Met with several people in the department and then with HR. Everyone was nice and went over the details of the job. I had time to ask questions and sell myself as a candidate.
Interview Questions: If I had any questions about the position or the department

title: Executive Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by office manager, and then pediatric surgeon, both asking me about my experience and desire to work there.  Questions included my personal motivation for wanting the job.  I was asked about how I would interact with patients, families, children, too.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Ambulatory Services Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a 3 step process - after being screened on the phone, I met with the recruiter, then with the potential manager, and then with the team to see if I'd be a good "fit". I think the interview with the recruiter was actually the most indepth, while the other two seemed to be more to get a sense of who I was. Everyone was very friendly and laidback - I recommend just trying to relax and be yourself as much as possible.
Interview Questions:
One question I had to think about a bit was, "What makes you interested in the administrative side of things?"
Also, the very first question I was asked when I got to the team interview was, "So, how much do you know about this position?"

title: Ambulatory Services Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in to interview with several different people for the position. First was with the project coordinator who just asked about my resume and why I might want to work at Children's. The next two I met with were the Practice Administrator and a man involved in finances. They both asked a little more in depth questions, but nothing hard or out of the ordinary. The next two were both young Ambulatory Service Representative III positions. They both seem unorganized and just discussed my classes at college. Finally I met with the surgical doctor I would be working under. Again, it was very low key and relaxed.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation at work, and how did you overcome it?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: there was nothing out the ordinary. had me meet with several people in the department but all the interviews were one on one. the entire process took about an hour.
Interview Questions: what is your greatest weakness?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Nurse Manager and peers, observation.  No questions related to Professional Nursing Practice. Felt over qualified based on the job description .  Nursing undervalued in this teaching hospital. Possibly only on the specialty unit that I worked on
Interview Questions: Situational questions

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with HR recruiter, short phone interview with manager, then an in-person interview with 3 different groups/people.
Interview Questions: Basic questions- biggest strength/weakness, tell me about your technical background, etc.

title: Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Respectful staff, they were punctual and asked in-depth questions.  I would have enjoyed working with their team.
Interview Questions: What causes health disparities

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview did not describe job in terms of what it was..... Horrible nightmare that expanded exponentially  over the next few years!!!
Interview Questions: What are your expectations of this job?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Required persistence and connection to a doctor within the field of study that I was interested in. Consisted of two interviews; one with the doctor's office assistent with whom candidates were asked about organizational skills as well as ability to learn new computer programs and one with the doctor who informed the candidate about the studies that they were running and the scientific approaches behind it as well as reviewing the candidate's résumé.
Interview Questions: technical questions about general biology and ability to deal with patient interactions.

title: Administrative Associate III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with a Division Manager for an AA position, then was introduced to the Chief who I would be the assistant of. The interview with the manager went well, she talked way more than I did. The interview with the Chief was strange, he asked two questions then said everything was OK.
Interview Questions: In your bedroom, where is your laundry?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I met my boss in a six sigma class and he offered me an internship
Interview Questions: Will you move to Boston?

title: Digital Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with HR.  One interview in person with hiring manager.  Was told there would be a follow up interview which was scheduled, then canceled.  Then I received a call that my references needed to be submitted.  After which, I was presented with an offer, never having had a second interview
Interview Questions: Detail your experience up until now.

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met a few rounds of people (5 total). The process was quick, they were kind and just asked general questions. They didn't try to trip me up or ask anything unusual; it was pretty straightforward. I first met the one woman I would be working directly under and the former research assistant. The just asked me general questions about my research experience as well as my future interests. They also talked a lot about the study and described what my job duties would be. I asked questions and they answered with a lot of detail. The second interview was with the two biostatisticians of the study and they asked me more directly about experiences I have had with research, statistics, and computers. Then I met with a PR representative (on a different day) before I was offered the position. The PR representative just asked me to talk a lot about myself: personality, hobbies, interests, goals for the future.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience with research.

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Process took 4 weeks from start to finish. Had a phone interview followed by an in-person interview at HR. HR told me about the positions he thought I would be best qualified for. Interviewed with the Division Manager and Division Chief. Questions were pretty straight forward. It was more like an informal chat than an interview. I think they want to be sure a person's personality fits more so than anything else.
Interview Questions: Nothing particularly difficult. How you deal with stress and difficult people. HR asked the standard what are your strengths and weaknesses but the interview with the manager and chief was just me talking about my resume and past experiences. Asked  If I was detailed oriented and didn't mind handling a large amount of paperwork and sitting behind a desk all day. More of a conversation than a formal interview

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied through our school, got an interview in 2 days. The interviewers asked me some specific questions about my experience in the system they are using.
Interview Questions: No.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: it was very easy and fast. Gave presentation and had brief discussions with the lab members and they asked me the questions regarding if i am suitable person for the concerned project
Interview Questions: it was very easy and fast. Gave presentation and had brief discussions with the lab members and they asked me the questions regarding if i am suitable person for the concerned project Do you have any experience with gene therapy

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: phone screening, basic questions, 3 letters of recommendation, onsite call, presentation of your prior work, discussing your interests, meeting with the team, seeing the setup, future projects, opportunity to grow, committment period
Interview Questions: Can you implement your previous technique to adapt to our methods

title: Pharmacy Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very responsive to all my questions and took time to explain the position and responsibilities. Even took me on a tour of the facility. They introduce me to some of the lead technicians on staff and they further explained the daily responsibilites.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans moving forward in terms of school?

title: Administrative Associate III Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was called in for an initial interview with another admin associate. About three weeks later interviewed with a manager then everyone on my floor. Then had to go to a satellite hospital to interview with other people
Interview Questions: What is your favorite quote and why

title: Research Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Went through 2 rounds of interviews for a dev job but it took 71 days in total for them to make a decision.  I ended up taking another job in the mean time.  At the end they told me they found an another candidate.  Interviews went ok, but would have appreciated if they moved faster to decision.
Interview Questions: How would you write a HR Database App?

title: Clinical Research Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was kind, but the Boss didn't know who I was. I would have appreciated if the Boss did her homework to actually care about who she was interviewing.   The hospital is world renowned, and they have a haughty attitude because of this.  It is a very hierarchal structure, and because it is on the East Coast, people are rude.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call about 3 months after I applied online.  Had a brief phone interview with the team leader and then scheduled an in person interview.  Met with a few different providers and then HR. Interview questions were pretty basic.
Interview Questions: How will your previous research experience help you excel in this position?

title: Resear Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Like any other postdoc fellowship. Reach out to your professor, show your interest and how you will contribute to the team.
Interview Questions: Nothing tough, mostly getting to know you and see if your a good fit with the rest of the lab.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview it the post-doctoral research fellow I would be working with directly. It was a very casual conversation. I had set up the interview because someone working in that lab was in contact with my college adviser and it was a good match for my skills and career goals.
Interview Questions: What are your long term career goals after this job? (interview was for a 2 year contract)

title: Administrative Associated II Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Taking throughout the department to meet many of the doctors and sat down w/ at least 5 people in separate situations. All were friendly and positive. I would suggest showing a sense of humor w/ the people you interview with. This does not mean that you level of professionalism need decline, but you'll be working with these people a lot and they want you to "fit."
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to an angry client or customer, how did you handle the situation?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the volunteer department and was sent an application. Process took 4+ weeks.
Interview Questions: None, basic interview questions.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was called in for an in-person interview following submission of my CV and cover letter.  I gave a 1 hour job talk on my previous research, met individually with other members of the lab, and then went out to lunch with a few lab members where I had the opportunity to ask additional questions.  At the end, I met with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: at 9:00am meet with one data manager and one physician. They asked  a few questions about my work experience and my programming skills. They tell me more about the position. Then I meet with the director. The director introduced the work enviornment and their hiring status. The director also asked about my programming skills.
Interview Questions: You don't have woke experience on sas programming

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Mainly 1:1 interviews with group seminar and Q&A. Brief session with practice administrator who seemed pleasant but very junior. Limited HR information was given. Tour of relevant clinical and inpatient facilities. 1:1 interviews were mild and non-aggressive but not that informative. Lunch with some residents/fellows was pretty informative. Credentialing was efficient and streamlined and all costs for licensing etc were covered. Overall relatively positive experience leading to me accepting offer despite surprisingly low salary but good benefits package.
Interview Questions: Why did you not choose to remain in your current school of medicine and department.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The process started with the PI contacting me to arrange 3 reference letters to be sent to him. Afterwards, about 2 weeks later, an interview was scheduled to come into lab to meet him and the other members. The PI and I first talked one on one, mostly to elaborate on my research experiences and my future plans and how it affects the time commitment for the job. Other than that, the interview concentrated a lot on describing the position and its expectations. Afterwards, I was given a tour and individually met other members of the lab. 
discuss the job description and his expectations for the position. In the end, it seemed that a huge component of the interview was to determine if the applicant, me, and the position were a good fit for each other. I did not feel like I had to 'prove' my worth or aggressively convince them to hire me. Also, HR was not involved in the interview process at all.
Interview Questions: Can you describe the project that you worked on?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Cambridge, MA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process did not take long. It could be a bit messy due to big organization. However, they seem to prefer US citizen employees over international employees
Interview Questions: Nothing seems to be unexpected. The interview went fairly well and normal. However, I was interviewed by MIT PhD Candidate rather than CHB employee, since my work base was at MIT.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview through Webcam, one on one. It was a long 2 hours interview, but nothing too intimidating. Most the questions were very basic, and focused more on behavioral questions. However, I was given couple research papers to read, and wrote my opinions around those papers before the interview. So, do expect technical questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflich with coworkers?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Contacted by Recruiter and communicated through email.  Interview set up and then a shadow day on the unit was organized.  Communication with the recruiter continued via email before job offer.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths?

title: Software Eng Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions:
There was a team of 3 people over the phone:

General questions: Explain design patterns in details, interface v/s abstract class, string vs stringbuffer, servlet life cycle, garbage collection. String-creator , final keyword.
Interview Questions: Autoboxing in jdk1.5

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was only one 20 minute interview over the telephone. The interviewer told me about the potential laboratory I would be working in and the project I would be involved in. The asked my about my background and my research interests.
Interview Questions: My career goals five years into the future.

title: ER Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call about a month after I applied. After the interview, I didn't receive a call back for another month with a job offer. I was told that it was really hard to get a job with an ADN so I obviously jumped at the offer. I'm not sure how true this is because this is my first job as a nurse.
Interview Questions: What made you decide to apply at Children's Hospital Boston?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: Most "techs" apply directly to a specific lab, usually via the lab manager or PI (Principal Investigator).  They might then call you to screen you over the phone, or invite you for an in-person interview on-site.
Interview Questions: Some labs might ask a simple "how do you make a solution with X concentration" question.

title: Surgical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager after a position had opened up in the department. He simply asked me if I was interested and how well I thought I could do the job.
Interview Questions: I don't remember the specific questions but it was more casual because I was already working in the department.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Nice staff
Interview Questions: What makes you a great candidate for this position?
